main_definition: An act of publicly supporting or approving something, often a product, service, political candidate, or cause.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Public declaration of support for an individual's skills or character
meanings_and_examples.example: When the famous athlete endorsed our sportswear brand, sales increased significantly.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A written agreement to back a check when it cannot be processed due to insufficient funds in the account
meanings_and_examples.example: I had an old friend who always carried his bank's endorsement on checks he wrote so that they would still pay out.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A product or service officially recommended by a person with influence, reputation, or expertise
meanings_and_examples.example: The famous chef's endorsement of the new restaurant helped attract diners to try their signature dishes.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An official approval for something such as legislation, policy, or a political candidate
meanings_and_examples.example: President Johnson gave his endorsement to Senator Smith's campaign during the debate on national television.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A statement that supports an opinion or viewpoint publicly and openly
meanings_and_examples.example: The environmental group made a strong endorsement of policies aimed at reducing carbon emissions.
